cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 135 miles ESE of Jacksonville Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northwest parallel to the northeast Florida coast, forecast to turn north tonight and then north-northeast on Thursday, skirting the Georgia and South Carolina coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the central South Carolina coast (around Charleston)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to Savannah River
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to Savannah River (Tropical Storm Warning); Storm Surge Warning Sebastian Inlet FL to Surf City NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeast Florida through the Georgia and Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (39–57 mph) likely today with a brief period of hurricane-force gusts possible as the western eyewall clips the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rises of 3–5 ft possible along the St. Johns River inlet and adjacent Atlantic beaches, with coastal flooding at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with isolated totals up to 9 inches, producing localized flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very large surf and life-threatening rip currents; isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands.
